Message.Title: Obama whining about FNC, GOP, etc
Message.Msg: No surprise here. Obama is very good at campaigning, and very bad at actually running a country. Thus, he sees everything in terms of opponents and acolytes, as opposed to problems and solutions. When things don't go exactly his way, he defaults EVERY TIME to a series of attacks, whining, and blaming of others. Look at yesterday ---- some GOPs and DEMs got together to start an immigration policy, and he immediatel butts in and starts trouble. Even the Hispanic caucus asked him tom stand down, but can't. By nature, he needs to create an opponent to campaign against, otherwise we will all (and not just some of us) see him as the weak guy behind the curtain.

Topic.Title: Challenge the austerity myth

Message.Msg: Really want to fix the economy, get back to American principles in regards to a fre economy. It's not rocket science, have govt get out of the way with over regulating business, over taxation, obamacare facing them this year and next, and embrace business to promote hiring. This administration has to, at some point, realize business is not the enemy. They need more than eight percent in this administration with business experience, the lowest number by 4-5 times than any other administration. Remember, govt only consumes, it produces nothing. Uncertainty is the enemy of business. Do away with unions. Do away with minimum wage laws. End all subsidies. End unemployment after 26 weeks. End the pandering by all politicians. End pork. Have every vote in both houses of Congress pass or fail on its own merits. Austerity debate needs to encompass all of govt. Govt is unsustainable in its present form. One country headed in the right direction is England. They have a true statesman as a leader. He will take any short term hit for long term gain. The English know money and numbers and will build their economy upwards. Why do you think they will never join the European Union. And if anybody thinks our debt is improving, our Dec., 2012 debt alone was 172 billion. Not good.
